model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I think age has really been my knees downfall. I also used to hike a lot and I put a lot of pressure on my legs. That is great that you only have a year. Maybe when you graduate you can come hang out on the beach with me. I can't surf but I would love to watch you.

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker A is offering advice and encouragement to Speaker B regarding the internship hunt, mentioning the medical field.
2. Speaker B is interested in sports medicine and enjoys surfing.
3. Speaker A suggests that surfing could be a way for Speaker B to make connections in the medical field.
4. Speaker A enjoys hiking along the coast and collecting shells, mentioning that their knees can't handle much else.
5. Speaker B is looking for internships in the sports medicine field and has asked professors for letters of recommendation.
6. Speaker B jokes about pretending to get hurt surfing to meet a doctor, showing a sense of humor and creativity.
